greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = k if k<n and k|n, = 0 otherwise, 1 <= k <= n; read by rows.
comment: A variant of A127093, which has T(n,n) = n. [The original definition said "Subsequence of A127093". Since all nonnegative integers are repeated infinitely often in both sequences, each one is a subsequence of the other, but there is no such relation on a row-by-row basis. - _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 08 2016]
Let A=A176891*A176891, B=A*A, C=B*B, D=C*C and so on, then the leftmost column in the last matrix (D) converges to A165552.
formula: T(n,k) = if n=1 and k=1 then 1 elseif n=k then 0 elseif k divides n then k else 0.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ and _Mats Granvik_, Apr 28 2010
ext: Definition corrected by _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 08 2016
